europe key-stone omnivision digital europe 2015_executive_summary - 41 the question was aided, performed on a pre-set list of product brands and the answer allowed for different options like regularly, sometimes and never. the analysis on the original answers showed ivoclar vivadent products and lava ultimate to be the most used products, with the highest percentages of regularly. after the mentioned brands, the main follower is vita enamic. given the low number of cases, the information should be considered an indication only. chart chairside milling production, main used products, secondary data processing - europe the secondary data processing on the results shown on chart 47 allowed to group all responses related to regularly and sometimes into one chart, thus becoming a multiple option question (chart 48 on the left). the chart clearly shows the predominance of ivoclar vivadent products, as previously anticipated. it is worth to highlight that, apart the clear leading position of ips e.max cad, the other products, namely ips empress cad, lava ultimate and vita enamic are very close one to each other. the further data processing (chart 48 on the right) sums up to 100% all responses (thus becoming a single option question), and the numeric distribution has been then shown by number of responses. the main information is the same seen on the left sided chart, that is, the predominance of ivoclar vivadent products, according to the responses of the sample. given the low number of cases, the information should be considered an indication only. key-stone omnivision digital europe 2015_executive_summary - question: What is the percentage of cases where multiple restorations are placed in one appointment in Germany?

context: and vhf stand out as the main followers. the higher penetration of this technology in germany and the simultaneous predominant presence of dentsply sirona explain the less recent average year of purchase (2016), revealing an older installed base compared to other technologies investigated in this survey. year of purchase average: 2016 base: 1.018 cases (whole sample) purchase channels buying behaviour 102 purchase channels - breakdown 103 what percentage of your routine orders are made using the following methods? quantitative analysis the breakdown by purchasing channels of consumable products for dental practices highlights interesting trends. firstly, italy is the country that, as a tradition, shows the highest percentage of contact through the sales rep. (26% compared to a total of 17%). additionally, germany and spain are the countries that show the highest weight of the websites of regular suppliers (38% and 45%, respectively). in contrast, the uk shows the highest percentage of e-commerce platform usage, including occasional suppliers (35%). french respondents, on the other hand, seem to prefer alternative contact methods such as phone and email. base: 1.018 cases (whole sample) avg. % use purchase channels - on-line / off-line 104 what percentage of your routine orders are made using the following methods? on-line: through the website of regular suppliers e-commerce platforms, including occasional suppliers off-line: contacting the supplier (phone, email, whatsapp, etc.) meeting the sales rep. other (specify) quantitative analysis the uk and germany are the countries that show the highest percentage of online channel usage for purchasing consumable products for dental practices (67% and 59%, respectively). france is not far behind germany, thanks to significant utilization of e-commerce platforms (26% compared to 21% overall). italy is the country showing the highest weight of offline channels, partly due to the previously mentioned extensive use of the sales rep. channel. base: 1.018 cases (whole sample) avg. % use purchase channels - frequency of use of price comparison platforms 105 german respondents are the ones who report the most frequent usage of price comparison platforms (38%). however, when considering the overall level of usage, the uk also shows a very high incidence. the lowest usage of price comparison platforms is found in france and spain, with 22% of respondents stating that they never use them in both countries. how often do you use price comparison websites or platforms? base: 1.018 cases (whole sample) dealers numeric distribution buying behaviour 106 henry schein 33% megadental 62% henry schein 28% megadental 14% gacd 51% aera-online 14% gacd 12% henry schein 33% m+w dental 13% dental leader 10% dentalclick 22% minilu 13% proclinic 9% dental good deal 21% dental bauer 12% dentsply sirona 7% dentsply sirona 14% dentalversender 8% umbra 6% promodentaire 14% gerl dental 7% dental good deal 5% septodont 13% kaniedenta 6% dentalclick 5% komet 13% basiq dental 5% dentalica 5% doctor strong 13% plandent 4% gerho 5% dpi 8% trade4dent 4% other 167% other 92% other 101% don't know / no answer 2% don't know / no answer 1% don't know / no answer 2% overlap index 2,79 overlap index 3,53 overlap index 2,18 total 100% total 200 total 224 dental leader 42% proclinic 58% henry schein 37% henry schein 35% henry schein 36% dental sky 23% umbra 24% dvd 31% dhb 19% dentalica 20% broker dental 28% trycare 16% gerho 20% dental express 18% kent express 16% dentaltrey 17% dental iberica 17% dd group 13% eli-dent 17% royal dent 16% ahp dental & medical 13% revello 14% dentaltix 15% wrights 11% astidental 11% casa schmidt 4% bdsi 6% dental today 9% dentalcost 4% kent dental 5% dentsply sirona 8% normon 4% optident 4% other 74% other 84% other 0% don't know / no answer 2% don't know / no answer 2% don't know / no answer 0% overlap index 2,91 overlap index 3,17 overlap index 1,62 total 200 total 194 total 200 it sp uk all countries fr de dental dealers: numeric distribution who are your main suppliers for consumable products? henry schein, megadental, gacd, and proclinic confirm their position as the main suppliers mentioned by the sample of respondents. however, some exclusively online suppliers are present in the top positions of the numerical distribution. this is the case with dental leader, dental good deal, and dentalclick. furthermore, it is worth highlighting the increase in the numerical distribution of dentsply sirona compared to 2018. 107 114% base: 1.018 cases (whole sample) dental dealers: numeric distribution - pqi index who are your main suppliers for consumable products? 108 the comparison between numeric distribution and the "top used", highlights relevant differences in the pqi index. example: henry schein is used by 33% of the respondents and 42% of them uses it as the main supplier. proclinic is less frequently quoted overall, but it is mentioned as the first supplier more frequently than henry schein (51%). the overlap index represents the average number of providers mentioned by each respondent: the sum of the percentage is 276%, that is, on average each respondent uses slightly less than 3 (2,76) providers for consumable products. it is interesting to note how the number of suppliers has increased compared to this is highlighted by the pqi index, which has gone from just over 1,5 to almost the use of multiple suppliers appears to be a structural trend in dentists purchasing behavior, thanks also to various online proposals. in fact, traditional dealers are noticed alongside online suppliers in the top positions of the frequency distribution. base: 1.018 cases (whole sample) dental dealers: numeric distribution - pqi index map who are your main suppliers for consumable products? the information described before, may be easily visualized in this positioning map, in which the quantitative variable (numeric distribution) and qualitative variable (pqi) are intersected. among the generalist suppliers, proclinic stands out as having the best performance in terms of the pqi index, meaning it is mentioned more frequently as the primary supplier. henry schein is by far the most mentioned overall and shows an improved ability to be mentioned as the first supplier in the practice compared to however, other main suppliers also show a better pqi index performance (e.g., in addition to proclinic, megadental and dental leader). although the numerical distribution is still low (4%), aera-online is the leading supplier in terms of pqi index performance. 109 numeric distribution + pqi index + base: 1.018 cases (whole sample) expectations about the future future changes in the activity of the practice do you plan to make changes to your practice over the next two years? just under half of the surveyed sample declares anticipating a change in their clinic's activity in the next two years. this percentage is higher in the uk, italy, and spain. approximately 2 out of 3 german respondents, on the other hand, state that they do not foresee any changes in the next two years. 111 changes to the practice base: 1.018 cases (whole sample) future changes in the activity of the practice do you plan to make changes to your practice over the next two years? what changes? among the anticipated changes, the intention to renovate or expand the clinic stands out, along with investments in digital workflow. however, the development of managerial and organizational skills is particularly prominent among the most mentioned changes. this phenomenon is more pronounced in italy and germany. the uk exhibits a higher percentage than the average regarding investments in marketing and communication. 112 total france germany italy spain uk base: 1.096 quotes (449 weighted cases: expected changes in the practice) italy: torino - roma +39 011 3119430 +39 011 3118669 www.key-stone.it key-stone@key-stone.it powered by
question: Who is the leading supplier in terms of pqi index performance?
answer: Aera-online is the leading supplier in terms of pqi index performance.

company. satisfaction related to the whole market here we can highlight some prerequisites (upper-right corner of the map, where almost all the competitors satisfy the market), some key factors of success (lower-right corner of the map, where companies are not always able to satisfy customers with regard to strategic issues), and indifference areas (lower-left side of the map) which become waste/not efficient areas when a company decides to invest in those items belonging to the upper-left side of the map since, they tends to satisfy the market but they actually dont affect the overall quotes) brand image vs recommendation: correlation analysis 62 brand positioning bivariate correlation analysis the bivariate correlation analysis is a technique that helps to identify and measure the influence of the independent variables (in this case, current users) on the dependent one (in this case, the recommendation). the bivariate correlation analysis has been used to quantify the relation between the score on the single items and the rating on the recommendation. therefore, it is possible to retrieve a hierarchy of importance from the individual statements and to display them in a chart, and then on a map. the vertical axis always shows the scores that the different items have received, on average, while the horizontal axis shows their influence on the recommendation. in this way, its obtained an estimated importance of each item proposed to the interviewees, which results a bit different from the score explicitly stated. the analysis of the weight of each of the statements, and not only of the declared importance, allows for some interesting considerations. the items have a different meaning according to the point of view with which they are considered: statistical note recommendation related to the whole market here we can highlight some prerequisites (upper-right corner of the map, where almost all the competitors perform positively), some key factors of success (lower-right corner of the map, where companies are not always able to meet the expectations with regard to strategic issues), and indifference areas (lower-left side of the map) which become waste/not efficient areas when a company decides to invest in those items belonging to the upper-left side of the map, since they show a lower weight on the recommendation. recommendation related to a specific company/product here the scheme is the same, but we can highlight the strength points in the upper-right side of the map, which can determine inefficiency or indifference if placed in the left side of the map. in the lower-right we can note an improvement area, where we can find the weak points of a certain company (higher than average item weight on the recommendation but lower than average item score). 63 items importance average score brand image vs recommendation: correlation analysis how much are worth the single items on the recommendation? overall 64 the question: What are the key factors of success for brands in the market?
answer: The key factors of success for brands in the market are high quality, trust, and innovation.

the construction of the satisfaction? correlation analysis the correlation analysis is a technique that helps to identify and to measure the influence of independent variables (in this case, current and former users) over the dependent one (in this case, overall satisfaction). it was used to quantify the ratio between score and individual factors and evaluation over satisfaction. therefore, it is possible to retrieve an "importance hierarchy" of individual demonstrations and to show them in a chart and, then, in a map. the vertical axis always shows the rating that the different instructions have received, in an average, while the horizontal axis shows their influence over the global satisfaction. thus, we get an "estimated importance" of each item proposed to the interviewees, which results a little different of that explicitly declared. the analysis of each factor's weigh, and not only the stated importance, allows some interesting considerations. the items have a different meaning according with the viewpoint with which they are considered: 32 statistical note satisfaction before the whole market: here we can emphasize some prerequisites (each upper right corner of the map, where almost all the competitors serve the market), some key factors to success (lower right corner of the map, where the companies are not always able to satisfy customers regarding strategical matters), and indifference areas (lower left corner), that constitute waste/inefficiency areas when a company decides to invest in such items belonging to the upper left corner of the map, since they are prone to meet the market, but they really do not affect the overall satisfaction. satisfaction regarding a specific company/product: here the scheme is the same, but the strong points are highlighted in the upper right corner of the map, where we can establish the inefficiency or low differentiation when placed in the left side of the map. in the lower right corner we can notice an improvement area, where we can meet the weak points of a given company. overall satisfaction rank hierarchy of importance of items. users 33 in the charts the weight of the evaluated items over brand satisfaction are represented. items with a high score can be perceived, but these are not relevant in the building of satisfaction and vice-versa. weight per item on the satisfaction score focus on the mean users (64 cases) weight on the satisfaction items score + + critical improvement areas correlation analysis: general satisfaction how much worth individual items on global satisfaction? users question: What is the main advantage mentioned by chairside milling unit owners in the use of their equipment?
answer: The main advantage mentioned by chairside milling unit owners in the use of their equipment is increased productivity.

context: good but expensive very affordable ideal quality/price ratio too expensive base: 1.018 cases (whole sample) attribute associations: summary 40 for each brand, the table summarizes to 100% the number of quotes received for the given attributes. it is not a frequency distribution among all brands, but for each brand, a frequency distribution of all attributes is shown. for example: out of 3m total quotes, scientific represents 9%. in dentsply sirona distribution, the attribute with the highest number of quotes is digital company, while for gc is excellent/the best. key take aways 41 in several cases, dentsply sirona is mentioned more frequently compared to various attributes, closely approaching - and in some cases surpassing - the performance of 3m. this is true, for example, for the attributes "high reputation, "innovative / cutting edge, flexible / versatile, young and modern. it is worth noting an improvement in ivoclar performance: "innovative / cutting edge, "friendly / intimate," and "easy to use" are some examples where the percentage of respondents mentioning this brand has significantly increased. there is an increase in brand awareness for companies in the digital world. although this may not be evident in overall brand awareness, it becomes clear when analyzing specific attributes. for example, align technology is mentioned in the attributes "innovative / cutting edge," "young and modern," and "reliable." regarding digital brands, it is also worth highlighting their significant presence in the attribute "innovative / cutting edge," a phenomenon not observed in a separate mention should be made for the attribute "digital company": apart from the obvious presence of brands in this area, it is interesting to note the clear positioning of dentsply sirona, which aligns well with the strategic change undertaken several years ago, making it the top brand mentioned in this context. key take aways 42 regarding the price positioning, there is a noticeable shift in dentsply sirona performance, as it not the first quoted brand anymore for the item very affordable" while it is the first quoted one in the items more related to a premium price area. there is a significant improvement for ivoclar in the attribute "ideal quality/price ratio," making it the third most mentioned brand in this edition after 3m and dentsply sirona. analyzing the frequency distributions of the items by individual brand, the following phenomena can be observed: for 3m, the item "scientific" is mentioned more frequently compared to "high reputation" in for dentsply sirona, the focus on the digital field is confirmed, but in terms of price, the most mentioned item is "too expensive" instead of "good but expensive" in for ivoclar, the scientific and innovative areas are mentioned more frequently, along with ease of use and flexibility. it is interesting to note the shift from "good but expensive" to "ideal quality/price ratio." for kulzer, the most mentioned items are "effective / concrete" and "flexible / versatile." correspondence analysis it is a descriptive statistical technique applicable to qualitative variables, whose purpose is to summarize and plot the relationships expressed by a frequency table. the analysis allows to represent as points of the same space (typically a plane) the considered variables, i.e. the rows and columns of the frequency table. with this system, the similarities / differences between rows and / or columns are processed respectively in proximity / distance of the points from one another. through the use of this statistical technique, it is possible to highlight the perception of the respondents and make a comparison among the brands under analysis. depending on the position of the attributes on the plan (active variables) and the proximity of the passive variables (represented by the brands), the perceived positioning in the imagery of the sample can be better understood. statistical note 43 correspondence analysis: positioning drivers 44 sustainable value and convenience this concept encompasses the effectiveness and practicality of the brand, social responsibility and environmental awareness, ease of use, flexibility and versatility, as well as a friendly and intimate approach in the customer experience. the perception is a convenient offering while respecting sustainability and user needs. those brands provide dentists with everything they need in a 360-degree approach. premium authority this definition summarizes the attributes present in this area: a high reputation based on a solid scientific foundation, excellence and superior quality, inspiring trust, a brands history and tradition. however, the attribute too expensive indicates that it may be considered a high-end or luxury brand with a higher price compared to the average. tech-forward leadership this area represents brands that stand out for their innovation, advanced digital presence, and the young and modern image they convey. these attributes indicate that the brand is at the forefront of new technologies, digitally oriented, and targeting a young and modern audience. tech- forward leadership emphasizes leadership in the technological field and the companys modern approach in providing innovative solutions. unlike the map proposed in 2018, the correspondence analysis in this edition does not clearly present two main axes. however, it is possible to identify certain positioning areas that are characterized by the presence of specific attributes that give rise to the names of these areas, as described below: correspondence analysis: positioning drivers 45 sustainable value and convenience premium authority tech-forward leadership correspondence analysis: complete map 46 correspondence analysis: brands only 47 sustainable value and convenience premium authority tech-forward leadership key take aways 48 first and foremost, it is interesting to note the positioning of orthodontic companies, which are primarily those belonging to the world of invisible aligner manufacturers. their positioning is perfectly compatible with the belonging area on this map. as observed in the past, catalog sales/mail-order businesses are positioned in the convenience area. straumann's positioning is heavily focused on performance, excellence, and the premium concept. it is noteworthy the positioning of dentsply sirona in the perception of dentists: it is close to the digital technology area but also relevant to the concept of being premium, as previously observed in the frequency distribution of attributes that have been analyzed. ivoclar and ultradent are positioned close to the concepts of effectiveness, practicality, and ease of use, with the brand gc being particularly close to the latter. kulzer's positioning is closely associated with the concepts of flexibility and versatility, voco with good value for money, and zhermack is closer to the convenience area. 49 brand image: items score brand positioning mean all brands (1.142 quotes) brand image: focus on brands - all brands in your opinion, how do you rate the mentioned brands in the following areas? 50 (scores: 1 totally irrelevant, 2 partially irrelevant, 3 neutral, 4 quite relevant, 5 totally relevant) this chart displays the overall average scores obtained by the investigated brands concerning specific attributes. the goal of the analysis is to compare the overall results with those obtained by the investigated brands to find out which items most significantly characterize the perceived image of each brand under investigation. brand image: focus on brands - 3m in your opinion, how do you rate the mentioned brands in the following areas? amann girrbach (25 quotes) satisfaction score: focus on completely satisfied - difference from mean labo 102 bivariate correlation analysis the bivariate correlation analysis is a technique that helps to identify and measure the influence of the independent variables (in this case, current and former users) on the dependent one (in this case, the overall satisfaction). the bivariate correlation analysis has been used to quantify the relation between the score on the single satisfaction items and the rating on the overall satisfaction. therefore, it is possible to retrieve a hierarchy of importance from the individual statements and to display them in a chart, and then on a map. the vertical axis always shows the satisfaction ratings that the different factors have received, on average, while the horizontal axis shows their influence on the overall satisfaction. in this way, its obtained an estimated importance of each item proposed to the interviewees, which results a bit different from the one explicitly stated. the analysis of the weight of each of the factors, and not only of the declared importance, allows for some interesting considerations. the items have a different meaning according to the point of view with which they are considered: statistical note satisfaction related to the whole market here we can highlight some prerequisites (upper-right corner of the map, where almost all the competitors satisfy the market), some key factors of success (lower-right corner of the map, where companies are not always able to satisfy customers with regard to strategic issues), and indifference areas (lower-left side of the map) which become waste/not efficient areas when a company decides to invest in those items belonging to the upper-left side of the map, since they tend to satisfy the market but they actually dont affect the overall satisfaction at all. satisfaction related to a specific company/product here the scheme is the same, but we can highlight the strength points in the upper-right side of the map, which can determine inefficiency or indifference if placed in the left side of the map. in the lower-right we can note an improvement area, where we can find the weak points of a certain company (higher than average weight on the company satisfaction but lower than average satisfaction score). 103 the charts shows the weight that the items evaluated have on the overall satisfaction and on the right, their individual satisfaction score. accuracy and reliability showed among the highest correlation scores, but this is true for the technical assistance and the possibility to use the equipment for a wide range of materials and or procedures. overall satisfaction: correlation analysis how much are worth the single items on the overall satisfaction? overall brands 104 items importance satisfaction score labo overall satisfaction: correlation analysis map how much are worth the single items on the overall satisfaction? overall brands 105 the map is the visual result of the two different charts seen in the previous slide. the horizontal axis represents the weight of each item on the overall satisfaction, while the vertical axis shows the satisfaction rating of each item. at the top right of the map there are the items that are very correlated to the overall satisfaction and the respondents stated to be more than average satisfied. at the bottom right there are the items that are very correlated to the overall satisfaction, but with lower than average satisfaction scores. it is interesting to see that the frequency of sw updates and the company flexibility are key items in the construction of the overall satisfaction. of repair 0,594 cost of sw updates 0,813 overall running costs 0,698 overall satisfaction: factor analysis the reduction into factors allowed us to obtain 3 main factors performance relationship and support operating costs factor 1 (performance) it is about everything related to the performance of the product, such as accuracy, handiness, reliability, which reflects into the increased performance of the laboratory, with productivity increase, and an easier life in the daily practice. factor 2 (relationship and support) it is interesting to note that among the most correlated items there are start up training and business support, which are not very closely related to the technical support, whose items are indeed part of this factor, but in certain ways are felt to be important in the relationship with the brands, especially regarding this kind of equipment. factor 3 (operating costs) the third factor actually is related to the impact that the operating costs of such kind of satisfaction by brand on the factors resulting from the factor analysis. + satisfaction level 108 the displayed values represent the satisfaction level of those factors, with a value ranging from -1 to +1 where 0 represents the overall mean value. for each investigated factor, the horizontal bars represent how much the satisfaction performance differs from the overall mean (vertical axis). the significant differences from the mean are marked with a red circle, so that it is possible to focus on the most interesting topics. with this regard, it is worth to note the higher than average performance of amann girrbach regarding the factor relationship and support, while it is significant the below average performance of 3shape and dental wings in the factor operating costs. overall satisfaction: multiple regression analysis 109 in order to complete the factor analysis, it is important to also assess the weight of these factors on the overall satisfaction to understand if an improvement in one of them can also improve the satisfaction of a particular brand. therefore, these factors are used as a basis for a further analysis, called multiple regression analysis that aims to understand how they explain the overall satisfaction. the figure "r2 = 0,629" means that more than 60% of the total satisfaction is explained and it is based on the given factors, which is a remarkable result. the overall model shows that the weight of the performance factor is slightly less than 50%, therefore the importance of this factor is relevant. the second factor is the relationship and support, then operating costs shows the lowest weight. it is interesting to look at the following slides, when the same analysis is carried out on the single brands. overall question: What is the net promoter score in 2015 compared to 2022?
answer: In 2015, the net promoter score was 0%, while in 2022, it improved considerably to 38%.
